intro: Didymoglossum cultratum, commonly known as the cut-leaf moss, is a small, creeping moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves that often have a distinct, sharp-pointed tip, giving it its common name. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rock crevices. Its sporophytes are relatively short and often have a single, slender seta. Didymoglossum cultratum is a low-growing, mat-forming species that plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for microorganisms.
